#Text=Learn to Think by Learning to Write
#Text=Within modern academia , the process of thinking has become somewhat jumbled and one-dimensional .
#Text=Critical thinking tends to win out over a more relaxed and creative approach , pushing the population toward a strict system of thinking .
#Text=By taking a look at the process of writing , this article aims to help with separating and individually appreciating these two branches of thought .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Identifying the Types of Thinking
#Text=Identify " first order " thinking .

column1: #Text=First order thinking is creativity- that frame of thought when you 're not worrying about grammar or logic .
#Text=It 's a productive period of brainstorming and simply allowing thoughts to pour out and follow their own sequence of events .
#Text=You disregard any form of organization or control , and the ideas flow .
#Text=Identify " second order " thinking .

column3:
abstract[41]	giv[41]	coref	12-6[44_41]
11-3	818-824	second	abstract[40]|abstract[41]	new[40]|giv[41]	coref	12-7[0_40]

11-5	831-832

column1: #Text=You might have heard of second order thinking as revision .
#Text=It 's the type of thinking that you resort to when you 're proof-reading an essay or writing an outline .
#Text=Second order thinking is logical , concise , and meticulous .
#Text=Separating " First Order " Thinking from " Second Order " Thinking

column1: #Text=Take a step back .
#Text=It 's easy to let the two types of thinking run together and become a mess of premature revision and lack of content .
#Text=Loosen your grasp on efficiency and simply allow ideas to flow before you start chopping them up .
#Text=Find a rhythm .
#Text=Try to consciously break first and second order thinking into separate processes .
#Text=Write in a stream of conscious style for as long as you can before you start to revise anything , even if you 're not making any sense at all .
#Text=Cycle back and forth between the types of thinking , producing blocks of information and revising them in chunks .
#Text=Applying the Process
#Text=Be creative .
#Text=First and second order thinking do n't just apply to writing essays .

#Text=Meaningful thought and writing go hand-in-hand , and the process of writing ideas down before scrutinizing and refining them can be applied almost endlessly , whether you 're making a WikiHow article or just trying to figure out where you stand on a political problem .
#Text=Be creative in your application of first and second order thinking and notice a new depth in your insight !
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do n't be frightened by a lack of organization and clear direction when brainstorming !
#Text=Just allow yourself to think freely , without censorship !
#Text=Thinking critically and logically are important tools , but so is a more relaxed , and creative thought process .
#Text=Take time to learn when each mindset works best !
#Text=Do n't be afraid to write , even when you 're confused about an issue that has nothing to do with academics !
#Text=Writing allows you to examine your thoughts from an outside perspective and really refine your thinking .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't fall into the trap of overactive revision !
#Text=It 's easy to constantly proof-read as you go , but your ideas may never reach their full potential if you 're constantly censoring yourself .
#Text=Do n't completely disregard proof-reading .
#Text=Even though revision is commonly overused , it is an incredibly important step toward a refined thought .
